name: Cradle Mountain Chateau

reviews.text: The hotel was comfortable and suited our needs. There was a 'library' which was a relaxing setting looking out over the bushland with a warming fire; perfect to either relax with a book or join with friends for a convivial drink. The Wilderness Photographic Gallery attached was well worth a visit with an abolutely beautiful display. This cultural gem compelements the wilderness around it. The buffet dinner is best avoided if you are looking for a good food experience. It was the cheaper option but not worth the money and the service slow. The restaurant was a definite improvement and although expensive the food was quite good. However, it is not for the food that you come to this area but for the wilderness experience which is outstanding and well worth any little inconvenience. There is a taste of the wilderness right at the hotel doorstep. Step out of the library and you are in a delightful easy bushwalk complete with local flora and fauna.
reviews.title: Attractive setting and ideal for discovering the Dove Lake area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in a delux spa room, which was split level, room was very comfortable but very dated decor and looked tired. Staff could not be faulted, very charming and helpful. Recommend a visit to the gallery opposite for some fabuous photography. Dove Lake walk also a must do, a relaxing 2 hour walk through stunning scenery.
reviews.title: Dove Lake Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is set in a great location. The staff are very helpfull and friendly. Our favourite part was the reception are with its log fire and polished floor but its a shame the rooms were not of the same standard (but i suppose it was significantly cheaper than some of the neighbouring accomodation. The rooms were clean, well furnished and comfortable. We booked a deluxe spa room but it was the same as the other rooms that we saw except the bath had the ability to blow bubbles and prob not worth the extra cash. The rooms, especially the bathrooms need a bit of a refurb, however as i said they are clean and well furnished if a little dated. The room service menu was very reasonably priced but the restaurant a tad pricey. Overall a good option if you are doing the national park on a budget and want somewhere of an acceptable standard.
reviews.title: Not bad for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cradle Mountain Chateau is a lovely place, beautiful surrounds, beautiful architecture and lovely warm rooms. We stayed in the split king with the spa and it was spacious - perfect really. The only thing I could whinge about was the layout of the rooms. We had a family opposite the narrow corridor and we could hear their every movements.
reviews.title: Lovely Room, Louder Surrounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i arrived and initially loved the location and atmosphere of this place. we upgraded for an additional $20 to a king room. excellent view of nature from our living area. we left to go explore and came upon cradle mountainlodge up the road and wish we would have stayed there - rustic atmosphere, big fireplaces throughout and nicer location. this place was fine but in the future we would stay at the lodge instead. downsides of this place is there is no huge fireplace area to sit and drink wine or meet people, our room only had one small heater on the lower level that didn't heat the entire room well and the atmosphere upon reflection was good but not great....not that lodge feeling you get with a log cabin.
reviews.title: great location, ok atmosphere
Kangeroos right outside your room!
reviews.text: Note that this is not a city hotel, so you can't rank a hotel based on usual rankings. But for a countryside/national park hotel, this is a very good quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: The rooms are nothing spectacular, but overall an ok stay.
Great location - avoid the buffet
reviews.text: - Only 60 rooms, and all rooms are on ground floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Wonderful service from all staff
reviews.title: dont bother to write a review!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Animals such as kangaroos right outside the balcony of your room
reviews.title: Cosy, Relaxing and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually take the time to read trip advisor before booking any accommodation but sadly on this occasion let someone else organise this hotel stay....i should have read all the other poor comments that people have posted... Not only is the alleged "chateau" in reality a motel at best, the service, room, food quality and overall experience by no means match the exhorbitant price tag! $750 for 2 nights of what was really a well situated motel with vastly a overpriced bland buffet of mediocrity! $15 bottles of wine being sold at $49 does not sit too well with me! I certainly expect to pay for my drinks but knowing the wholesale price of the wine I believe a 700% mark up is is tantamount to daylight robbery at best! Nor does the fact that to get a light for a cigarette one can expect to be charge $1??? Seriously, is this a 5 star hotel or a prison courtyard? $10 an hour to use the internet in a 5*????? Seriously, get a sense of reality...and add it my the bill....
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING CHATEAU..YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chateau Motel advertises that it has a spa! lol...well, they somehow forget to point out that it is actually in a tiled room the size of a prison cell with no natural light or view...should the spa not benefit from natural light and views or am I just being fussy?
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay with Wallaby
Nice but take your money with you
reviews.text: On a brighter side there were wombats in the carpark. I did take a photo and fortunately did not observe any photo taking fe at the bottom om my bill!

After the first day we explained to the staff that we were very unhappy with all aspects of the 'motel' including room (everything is in a painfully eye stinging mustard yellow!), the bathroom (dark cupboard with spa) and food (they sell wallaby at $35...there is a lot of wallaby road kill in the vicinity...I am jumping to no conclusions!
reviews.title: Up in the Clouds

reviews.text: For dinner one night we went to the Cradle Mountain lodge, good food, great atmosphere, well worth a visit!
reviews.title: elegant and unpretentious, but close to nature

reviews.text: We stayed here for a conference where the conference attendees had filled up the entire hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.text: -The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help.
reviews.title: Several common rooms scattered around...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The rooms are of good quality and good for the price you pay. The bathrooms are a bit dated, but clean and functional.
reviews.title: Waste of money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Wildlife comes right to your balcony window day and night.
reviews.title: Good experience but poor sleep

reviews.text: - The conference food for lunch and dinners was great.
reviews.title: Wildlife comes right up to your balcony.

aka: Cradle Mountain Chateau Hotel Cradle Mountain-Lake St. Clair National Park
description: On the fringe of alpine wilderness, Pure Tasmania's Cradle Mountain Chateau sits on the edge of Cradle Mountain Lake St Clair National Park. It's the perfect base for alpine walks. Be pampered at the end of the day with a soothing massage and outdoor hot tub at Calm Day Spa; and enjoy hearty mountain fare and a crackling log fire. The Chateau is home to The Wilderness Galley, a magnificent collection of nature photography.
